title: Running unit test case in folder test.
body_html:
❓ Questions and Help

I have a question, In the folder test, some test case can be run by python -m unittest test_*.* to test a unit case, but for test_torch.py, it can not be use python -m unittest test_torch.*, for example, when you run python -m unittest test_torch._TestTorchMixin.test_ger, there will have the following error:

traceback (most recent call last):
File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main
"main", mod_spec)
File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
exec(code, run_globals)
File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/main.py", line 18, in
main(module=None)
File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/main.py", line 94, in init
self.parseArgs(argv)
File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/main.py", line 141, in parseArgs
self.createTests()
File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/main.py", line 148, in createTests
self.module)
File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/loader.py", line 219, in loadTestsFromNames
suites = [self.loadTestsFromName(name, module) for name in names]
File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/loader.py", line 219, in
suites = [self.loadTestsFromName(name, module) for name in names]
File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/loader.py", line 204, in loadTestsFromName
test = obj()
TypeError: test_ger() missing 1 required positional argument: 'self'

Thanks!

body:
## ❓ Questions and Help

I have a question,  In the folder test, some test case can be run by `python -m unittest test_*.*` to test a unit case, but for test_torch.py, it can not be use `python -m unittest test_torch.*`, for example, when you run `python -m unittest test_torch._TestTorchMixin.test_ger`, there will have the following error: 

traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/__main__.py", line 18, in <module>
    main(module=None)
  File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/main.py", line 94, in __init__
    self.parseArgs(argv)
  File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/main.py", line 141, in parseArgs
    self.createTests()
  File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/main.py", line 148, in createTests
    self.module)
  File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/loader.py", line 219, in loadTestsFromNames
    suites = [self.loadTestsFromName(name, module) for name in names]
  File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/loader.py", line 219, in <listcomp>
    suites = [self.loadTestsFromName(name, module) for name in names]
  File "/home/sys_dltest/anacondaenv/anaconda3/envs/pytorch3/lib/python3.6/unittest/loader.py", line 204, in loadTestsFromName
    test = obj()
**TypeError:  test_ger() missing 1 required positional argument: 'self'**

Thanks!
